reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Installation was a bit of a pain when wrapping wires around the screws as the screws will completely go inside of the housing when the slightest pressure is placed on them. Half of the install was getting under these screws. The settings and adjustments allowed us to tune the dimmer to work with the existing lights and avoid flicker. We notice that they hate running with our generator and frequently cut off entirely at random and the dimmer will stop working. They're fine with mains power, however.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2025
reviews.title: They work well after install, are finicky to hook up, and do not like working on generator power.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Wish the light was just a little bit brighter, but it is good enough when it is totally dark and I'm trying to locate the switch. Beats running my hand all over the wall to find it. This is in a bathroom where a brighter light would of been fine, but I would buy these again for a bedroom as the light is so dim it would be perfect in a sleeping room, so as not to bother your sleep. I have bought several Legrand products and they are always of good quality.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.title: I can find it in the dark now

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: I like the illumination of this switch. It is very faint, but does not look tacky as some other illuminated switches do. I also like the ability to backwire. (not backstab).
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.title: High quality switch.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: My wife and I just moved into a new house and the builder installed one of these. We noticed the tiny locator LED one night and I thought I'd get a few more and install them myself. They were easy enough to install and the LED works great to help someone locate the switch in the dark. The only negative I can say is they have a really loud click sound when you turn the switch on or off. Otherwise, they are great.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.title: Does what I need it to, just a little too loud

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Product works as advertised, works with incandescent and halogen lights only. Does not work with LED, clearly stated in the picture. I was not able to use my two switches because they leaked voltage when a LED bulb was connected. The two switches that I purchased worked correctly with incandescent bulbs. The build quality for this switch was of good quality but the LED indicator (locator light on the switch) was so tiny that we could not see this light from a rooms distance. I wouldn't purchase this if you're looking for a locator to find the switch in the dark.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2023
reviews.title: Does not work with LED, I didn't see this until after I made the purchase and did the install.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Unless these have changed recently, the front of the switch has the company name impressed (like engraved) into the plastic. Because you often touch this, it tends to collect dirt/grime. You can sort of clean it out with a toothbrush, but it is frustrating that you have to do so. I chose these switches for their clean and sleek look, and paid a premium for that. I would happily give them five starts if they would remove the name, or print it in a way that doesn't collect dirt.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviews.title: Impressed company name on switch collects dirt

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Perfect replacements for 30 year old rocker switches in bathroom. Single pole for bathroom light and fan. Old switches were so old one shattered and broke apart. Wiring was a little confusing as red wires were mixed with black wires on the same lines. Old switches were single pole so no issues just replicating the previous installation. Nice rocker switches, feel good and solid, work well with subtle white LED glow light at top of switches.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2022
reviews.title: Nice upgrade, feels sturdy. Subtle white LED lights, single pole for bathroom light and fan.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: They're great and don't emit any light, just enough for the eye to walk into a dark room and you're going to know exactly where the switch is. This is not a nightlight, it's purely a switch that's easy to find in the dark.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2022
reviews.title: A cool must have and easy DIY

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: I’ve installed dozens of switches as a homeowner. This Legrand switch is solid and is equal to or better than the others I’ve used. I believe this switch is described as “lighted.” Be advised that there is one very small, green LED just above the switch (think the size of a pencil point). Personally, I like it. Neat and clean. Some illuminated switches have a bigger light behind the switch itself. If you are trying to match an existing switch, you might want to keep that in mind.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2022
reviews.title: It goes on and off. Any questions?

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: It's difficult to tell well enough, looking at the item's page's pictures, that the light put out by these is as insufficient as it is. So, I took one & made sure it looked as close to how it does to my eyes in the actual picture.(Thumbnail looks all black, cuz the room(to my eyes) was nearly black. That tiny lit pixel almost perfectly centered is the light from the switch with which I'm supposed to locate said switch) I'd have to wait, I dunno, like a minute after turning the light out for my eyes to adjust to be able to see that light well enough for quick acquisition. I'm looking at replacing this one with a motion detection switch. The switch works fine, & the locator light does turn on when the switch is in the OFF position, so it gets 3 stars, but the whole point of installing one of these, vs those locator-less ones that cost 1/3 or less, is to be able to quickly locate where the light switch is. Come on guys. A PinHole?? I'm not sure what you were thinking there, but if it's gonna provide such little 'locatability', you should probly update your product page/info to reflect that so buyers can make more informed decisions vs writing less than satisfied reviews such as this. Honestly, I can only see this being useful in a small closet where the pinhole light is aimed right at yur face when you open the door. -_-
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2022
reviews.title: Locator Light Insuficient for Rooms Larger than Small Closet

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: I think Legrand may have produced a bad batch of these as I’ve ordered 2 of these and the LED indicators on both goes out after a few minutes. The indicators on all my other Legrand switches work fine, it’s just this model that’s been problematic.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: My preferred brand of switch became difficult to find in October 2020. I needed a switch with a locator light and this was the only one I could find. After I installed this light, I noted that the locator light was a miniscule pinpoint at the switch edge which is difficult to locate in the dark even when you are looking for it. I was expecting at least one of the 2 rocker panels to glow like my preferred brand but it did not. I do not believe this switch detects motion as the review template implies.

reviews.title: Location light is tiny

reviews.text: Needed a replacement for an old wall switch (also Legrand but a 12 year older version of this one). The connections matched one for one and was very easy to install. The small LED on it is not really noticeable during the day but at night when it is dark it stands out just enough to make it easy to find. The rocker feels solid and clean.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: As others have commented... the light is very small. But I find it perfect for my use - in the almost total darkness of my bedroom the light is plenty bright enough to distinguish the switch from the one beside it. So now in the middle of the night I turn on the correct switch (for the closet) instead of accidentally hitting the other switch that turns on the lights for the entire room and wakes up both me and my wife. There's really no need for a brighter or larger light.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: I know many people have purchased these thinking the entire rocker paddle illuminated at night, however that is not the case. There is a pinhole sized LED just above the rocker that illuminates in the darkness. At first, I wasn't too thrilled about it, however, I love them now! The small LED keeps the switch looking very chic during the day and at night illuminates sufficiently to allow you to find the light switch. Additionally, the tactile feel on the rocker is excellent and smooth. It will not randomly toggle on and off.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021
reviews.title: Small LED

This switch produces only the teeny tiniest pinprick of light - not sure what its purpose is, I can barely see it. Wish I could post a picture, but I can’t show you what it looks like in my garage because it’s DARK in my garage and you can’t see this light switch.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: Read description carefully. This is not an illuminated paddle switch. Just contains a minute "LED Locator Light" at the top of the switch that glows when the switch is in the off position. The minuscule dot is very hard to see in the dark. Also while not stated on the package, Legrand says "This switch is compatible with incandescent loads only and is not recommended for use with LED or CFL lamps." Really? Most homes are replacing lamps and fixtures with LED bulbs.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
reviews.title: Not an illuminated switch

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant TM870WSLCC10 15 Amp Rocker Wall Switch with Locator Light, Single Pole Decorator Light Switches, White (1 Count)
reviews.text: I purchased this lighted wall switch since I am looking for a 21st century solution for lighted Decora switches. Why is this so hard? Old switches are illuminated by an orange neon bulb with an average lifespan of about 10 years. My request is simple: A decora wall switch with an LED on it to light it up in the dark. Must look good (some options you find for lighted switches are VERY 1970), be reliable, and put out just enough light to be visible. No need for wi-fi, phone apps, internet connectivity, etc. I just want a lighted switch. Legrand is a good brand name that I recognize. Some other switches out there look cooler (there's a glass touch one that looks REALLY cool but has absymal quality ratings) but I don't want something that will fail early or worse, burn my house down. So I opted for this switch, recognizing that reviewers here commented that the light is TOO small/dim/subtle. My thoughts: The switch seems substantial to the feel, matches the regular decora switches and is very simple to install. If you take more than 10 minutes to install this switch then you are working too hard. :) As always, be safe and make sure the circuit is de-energized before installing. Connections consist of hot, load, and ground. No neutral wire is needed. The illumination: Other reviewers are right. The illumination is a TINY white LED, literally about the size of a pencil point. I have attached a picture to this review - and it makes the LED look bigger than it really is! It's visible in no-light situations as a white dot but doesn't light up the switch paddle area. I think that Legrand should have made the LED a little wider (think narrow rectangle, I know they make LEDs in this size) and they'd have a winner on their hands. Note that the pencil point LED *is* the LED and is not a hole allowing visibility to an LED in the back - so you can't drill out the trim to make the light bigger. Since the lighting effect is a little TOO subtle I'm giving this about a 5 out of 10. Overall I like the switch and I like the idea behind it, but I think I'll keep looking for a better solution for an illuminated Decora switch. That's a bummer because this one definitely has potential and I'd like a lot more lighted switches for my home.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
reviews.title: It's VERY subtle - almost TOO subtle!
